Nope.  No steady state.
8G is chump change for a long running crawler.
Its a state db of where have you been.  So, of course it
grows, as you run longer.

I believe the largest I've seen is about 2T, before I ended
a crawl.

I thought about crawling with it on EC2, and decided it would need
a different architecture to be viable there.

John

> I've got Heritrix running in Amazon EC2, and I'm still mucking around

> moved everything to /mnt, where you're supposed to throw data on EC2,
> but my question is, why does this directory grow so large? Does it have
